page.title: 12TECHNOLOGICAL PROGRESS IN BN
page.content: MILKING: Four of the farms have the Herringbone Parlour system.Only one still has the Abreast system.Two farms have automatic cup removal.Milk is collected in jars or travels along pipes to the refrigerated bulk tanks.Milk churns are no longer used.Large container tankers collect milk. FIELDS: In this wet area fields are mole drained.Large special machines lay the pipes.No grain is grown,only grass for silage and hay. SILAGING:Contractors cut the grass on three farms.Two farms do all the cutting, hauling and compressing themselves.Only hay used to be made. HEDGE TRIMMING: Hooks have been replaced by highly mechanical hedge trimmers.
